alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:29AM EST until December 25 at 1:52AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour affecting Washington, Jackson and Lawrence Counties. White River at Petersburg affecting Pike, Daviess, Gibson and Knox Counties. White River at Hazleton affecting Knox and Gibson Counties. White River at Elliston affecting Greene, Daviess and Knox Counties. .Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches will cause minor flooding to develop along portions of the White River and the East Fork White River in southern parts of central Indiana. Flooding may persist into Christmas Eve for portions of the White River. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins to flood several Pike County roads. Many of the following county roads begin to flood around this level...east of SR 57 include CR 750N...CR 600N and CR 1000E. Pike county road subject to flooding west of SR 57 include...CR 250 W...CR 400W...CR 675N...CR 700 N...CR 1000w...CR 900W...CR 700W and CR 775W. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Saturday /9:30 AM CST Saturday/ the stage was 14.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late tonight to 18.1 feet Monday morning. It will then fall to 17.5 feet and begin rising again early Tuesday afternoon. It will rise to 18.3 feet Wednesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1130 PM EST /1030 PM CST/.
